text: MBCC. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and chocolate. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with heavy alcohol. Boozy. Oily. 130517
[5/13/17] Draught at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Green session. Black, tan head. Roast, chocolate, vanilla, sweet, full-bodied, rounded.
Sampled at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Pitch black pour with a tan head. Notes of chocolate, light roast, light oak barrel, bourbon and bourbon heat, cherry bitterness, light vanilla.

Tap @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017  
Absolutnie to nie jest to co lubię;( W aromacie i smaku kwaśne wisnie., czerwone porzeczki, kwaśna kawa i gorzka czekolada. Mało ciała, słabo ułożone z trochę za mocnym alkoholem.

750ml bottle pours out dark brown almost black topped with a tan head. Nose is roast malts some chocolate pit fruit rich sweetness and some chocolate. Taste is as the nose with some dark fruit notes roast malts chocolate.

Bottle at the 10th Boise Imperial Stout Tasting. Pours a deep brown color with a modest tan head. Aromatic with heavy roast, sweet pit fruit, and barrel notes. Big flavor profile of espresso and mocha, lots of roast, some vanilla.
Tap at mbcc17, copenhagen. Black color, brown head. Aroma has coffee, vanilla, some sweet caramel notes. Taste has roasted malts, vanilla notes, chocolate.
Best beer at the bruery tasting, big balanced and full of flavor, Sweet bourbon (brownie) flavor, light vanilla good amount or roasty bitter chocolate. Great balance, impressed.

Type: 750-ml. bottle
Glass: AleSmith Barrel-Aged Reserve snifter
From: heresy22 on Beer Advocate 
Price: N/A
Purchased: N/A; Received March 20, 2017
Consumed: April 9, 2017
Reviewed as: American Porter
Misc.: Bottled on Dec. 13, 2016

Thanks, Chris!

Had two tasters of this at The Bruery Society Kickoff Party on Jan. 7, 2017. It was my favorite out of the ~20 beers I tried. Excited when I walked into my office one day and this was waiting for me. Thanks so much, Chris! Gave it a 4.75 (out of 5) on Untapped at the time and I expect this to be around that once again.

Poured a black color with 1-to-2 fingers of frothy tan head, which thinned out rather quickly. Serene setting underneath. Very good spotty lacing. World-class retention. (Sight - 4.25)

First sniff brought me back to that glorious day of The Bruery greatness. Got rich coffee malts, smooth oaky bourbon, vanilla, toffee, caramel, cocoa, dark chocolate, semi-sweet chocolate morsels, hints of black cherry, semi-char wood, chocolate syrup, milk chocolate, gooey fudge and some earthy leather. (Smell - 4.75)

Taste might have even been better than the nose. Wow. This once again brings me back. Got sticky milk chocolate, smooth oaky bourbon, vanilla, caramel, toffee, cocoa, cinnamon, coconut flakes, semi-sweet chocolate morsels, hints of tart cherry, chocolate syrup and gooey sugary fudge. Incredible. (Taste - 4.75)

Full body. Creamy-to-sticky texture. Average carbonation. Long, smooth, warming finish. (Feel - 5.00)

Whoa. Maybe even better than I remember. Definitely in my Mount Rushmore of beers. (Overall - 4.75)

4.75 100 A+
bomber from fff. sweet boozy nose, dark head, very cherry, creamy, ran out too soon.

March 16, 2017 - bottle from my membership enjoying while watching opening day of March Madness. Black pour with nice amount of head that lasted a little bit and left quite a bit of bubbles at the edges. Aroma was all about the delicious coffee with some vanilla and mild bourbon/wood. Taste was a nice rich coffee, light roast, vanilla sweetness, mild bourbon and very minor touch of tart cherry. Really enjoyed this, glad I got an extra bottle, wish I had some more though.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2017 4 bombers purchased from the brewery. Bottled on 3/3/2017.  Pours dark black with a dark brown head. Chocolate, dark cherry, tobacco, and bourbon notes. Very subtle coffee notes. Great beer.
